reviews:
Wir nutzen diese Lampe seit rund 12 Monaten und nutzen diese immer wieder zur Kontrolle der Zäune unserer Pferdekoppeln. Die Lampe steckt in den dunklen Monaten täglich in der Tasche und wir lassen uns immer wieder neu überraschen ob die funktioniert, verlassen uns aber Null darauf - wenn sie funktioniert, ist alles im Bereich des erwarteten "Prima"!

Die kleine handliche Größe und das Gewicht ist sehr angenehm, das Gehäuse erscheint wertig, ist allerdings nicht wirklich gegenüber banaler Beschlagfeuchtigkeit resistent (der Kopf mit der LED bis dato durchaus), das Licht in höchster Stufe läßt im Bereich von 150 - 200 Metern noch Details erkennen. Darüber wird es allerdings schnell eng, von fast 400 Metern ganz zu schweigen; da ist dann der Mondschein heller.

Absolut miserabel und eine völlige Fehlkonstruktion, der Ein/Ausschalter mit Null Druckpunkt, der sich mit Handschuhen sehr schlecht bzw. gar nicht bedienen läßt, gerne selbständig bei geringster Berührung in der (Jacken)Tasche die Lampe einschaltet; in der Jacke kann es aufgrund der sich anbahnenden Verbrennung ggf. gerochen werden, anderswo ist mindestens der Akku unerwartet leer (beides mehrfach erlebt).

In Toto: Wie von uns von heute produzierter Ware überwiegend erwartet, meist in Asien billigst hergestellt, von Marketing Einkommensabhängigen, gar den Vollpfosten namens "Influenzer" (seinerzeit Dummschwätzer genannt), in schillernden Farben dargestellt, doch bestenfalls nur absolutes Mittelmaß aber mangels realer Alternative halt doch "gefressen"!

reviews: This flashlight has been performing admirably since I received it about 6 months ago. Some of the best features is has is that it fits well in smaller hands, it has a good knurled texture on the body and it's easy to charge (micro USB port built into the flashlight). The crenelated bezel makes for a great defense tool though it is unlikely you will ever need to use it for that. As an inspector, I hold the flashlight in several positions. This flashlight gets 3 stars because the button close to the head of the flashlight is flush and not easily found. The rear gives you the maximum lumens, very handy for inspections. I would have ideally liked to be able to toggle through modes using the tail cap but you cannot. You can only toggle through lower modes by using the side switch. There is a square part toward the tail of the flashlight meant to keep the flashlight from rolling. I find this completely useless and it actually negatively impacts the ergonomics of the flashlight. Also, in all power modes, there is a clearly visible purple dot in the middle of the hot spot. This is very distracting and actually diverts attention away from the object being inspected. If the light didn't have that and the square metal piece and if the side switch had a more tactile feel, it would be a 5 star light. For inspectors, having neutral light is rare. Most lights are around 6000K. This is not. 4000K makes a difference when inspecting electric and HVAC systems (and in general). There are other flashlights I use more frequently but this makes a nice back-up or a good flashlight for clients to use when they accompany me in dark spaces.

review_title: Not my brightest light, not the longest throw, but my favorite all-around.
reviews: I have both the L30 and the L16. I thought I would like the longer throw L16 best, but after two months when I go for my daily walk at night I much prefer the L30. The L30's broader beam pattern is far more practical for walking on a dark night, more effectively lighting up a bigger, broader area - with almost but not quite the throw distance of the L16. I find the beam pattern of the L16 overly tight and focused for simply walking in the dark - particularly when you are lighting the path for more than one person. One is much less able to see what may be to the left and right of the bright, small and farther-reaching L16's spot - or directly underfoot - and it is the darkest nights that make me appreciate the benefits of the L30s broader beam pattern. The L16 could be better suited to security, patrol or spotting deer or other game at night. The L30 is more than sufficiently bright. Turbo and the highest setting are impressive but do drain the batteries more quickly and heat the unit up, so these settings get only intermittent use from me. Have not had it long enough ot rate durability, but can't ding it on that basis either. One charge lasts me two weeks under such use - typically 3 1/2 to 4 hours. Knowing what I know now, I would buy two of these and forsake the L16.
